The Thompson submachine gun is a blowback-operated, air-cooled, magazine-fed selective-fire submachine gun, invented by the United States Army Brigadier general John T. Thompson in 1918. It was originally designed to break the stalemate of trench warfare of World War I, but was not finished until after the war ended. The Thompson was then widely adopted by the U.S. armed forces and their allies during World War II. It is the first weapon to be labelled and marketed as a "submachine gun".
 This modernized version features an ergonomic stock, a foregrip, rails, 45° iron sights and a tactical green Laser Aiming Module.

 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] Silencer: .45 ACP suppressor
 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] Sights: all colimators, Trijicon ACOG and ELCAN SpecterDR Sight
 %c[ui_gray_2]COMPATIBLE MOD KITS:
 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] Custom, Specialized, and Mercenary modification kits
